sentences.en: By threatening to indict whole companies — spelling certain bankruptcy — he forces their managers to settle.
sentences.cn: 他威胁要起诉所有公司——从某种程度上看,这将意味着破产——从而迫使这些公司的经理们达成和解协议.

sentences.en: He was later indicted on corruption charges.
I can indict you for abducting high school student.
sentences.cn: 我可以告你诱拐中学生.

sentences.en: I certainly don't mean to indict Holy Communion.
sentences.cn: 我绝对不是要诋毁圣餐礼.

sentences.en: In July it decided not to indict her for second - degree murder.
sentences.cn: 7月份,该陪审团做出了不起诉普医生犯有7级谋杀罪的裁决.

sentences.en: In law practice fair principle is applied to medical civil indict more than before.
sentences.cn: 在司法实践中公平原则越来越多地被应用到医疗侵权民事诉讼案件.

sentences.en: In simple civil cases, the plaintiff may indict verbally.
sentences.cn: 对简单的民事案件, 原告可以口头起诉.

sentences.en: Police indict he for breaking the law.
Prosecutors said they wouldn't indict Mr. Hatoyama due to insufficient evidence.
sentences.cn: 检察官说因为证据不足,不会起诉鸠山由纪夫.

sentences.en: The equipment suppliers always inquire, suspect and indict to assert their lawful behalf.
sentences.cn: 承制单位往往采取提出询问 、 质疑与投诉的方式,维护自身合法权益.

sentences.en: The grand jury indicts or refuses to indict accused persons.
sentences.cn: 大陪审团可起诉或拒绝起诉被告.

sentences.en: Us list of charges give to a grand jury, asking them to indict the accused.
sentences.cn: 刑事起诉书,交给大陪审团的指控一览表, 要求他们志诉刑事被告.

words.tran_cn: 诏示；古罗马每隔15年一次的财产评价公告

trans.tran_cn: 起诉, 控告, 指控, 告发
trans.tran_en: to officially charge someone with a criminal offence
to officially charge someone with a criminal offence
